required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study To Investigate The Safety And Efficacy Of CP- 690,550 In Patients With Moderate And Severe Ulcerative Colitis.
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Placebo Controlled, Double Blind, Parallel Group Multi-Center Study In Order To Investigate Safety And Efficacy Of CP- 690 550 In Subjects With Moderate To Severe Ulcerative Colitis.

brief_summary.textblock: The hypothesis of the study is that at least one dose of CP 690 550 is superior to placebo (inactive drug) in inducing remission in patients with moderate to severe ulcerative colitis.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Response
primary_outcome.description: Clinical response was defined as a decrease from baseline in Mayo score of at least 3 points and at least 30 percent, with accompanying decrease in subscore for rectal bleeding of at least 1 point or absolute subscore for rectal bleeding of 0 or 1. Mayo score: instrument designed to measure disease activity of ulcerative colitis. Total score range: 0 to 12; higher score=more severe disease. It consisted of 4 subscores: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, findings of flexible proctosigmoidoscopy and physician global assessment, each ranged from 0 to 3 (0=normal, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Remission
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical remission was defined as a total Mayo score of 2 points or lower, with no individual subscore exceeding 1 point. Mayo score:instrument designed to measure disease activity of ulcerative colitis. Total score range: 0 to 12; higher score=more severe disease. It consisted of 4 subscores: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, findings of flexible proctosigmoidoscopy and physician global assessment, each ranged from 0 to 3 (0=normal, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Endoscopic Response
secondary_outcome.description: Endoscopic response was defined as decrease from baseline in the findings of the flexible proctosigmoidoscopy subscore of the Mayo score at least 1 point. Mayo score: instrument designed to measure disease activity of ulcerative colitis. Total score range: 0 to 12; higher score=more severe disease. It consisted of 4 subscores: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, findings of flexible proctosigmoidoscopy and physician global assessment, each ranged from 0 to 3 (0=normal, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Endoscopic Remission
secondary_outcome.description: Endoscopic remission was defined as the findings of flexible proctosigmoidoscopy subscore of the Mayo score equals 0. Mayo score: instrument designed to measure disease activity of ulcerative colitis. Total score range: 0 to 12; higher score=more severe disease. It consisted of 4 subscores: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, findings of flexible proctosigmoidoscopy and physician global assessment, each ranged from 0 to 3 (0=normal, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Partial Mayo Score at Week 2, 4, 8 and 12
secondary_outcome.description: Partial Mayo score was ranged from 0 (normal or inactive disease) to 9 (severe disease) and calculated as the sum of 3 subscores: stool frequency, rectal bleeding and physician's global assessment, each ranged from 0 to 3 (0=normal, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Total Inflammatory Bowel Disease Questionnaire (IBDQ) Score at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: IBDQ: Psychometrically validated patient reported outcome (PRO) instrument for measuring disease-specific quality of life (QOL) in participants with IBD. IBDQ consists of 32 items, each item score ranged from 1 (worst possible response) to 7 (best possible response). Total score is sum of each item score, ranged from 32 to 224 with higher score indicates better QOL. Positive change in total score indicated improvement in QOL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Level of C-Reactive Protein (CRP) at Week 4 and 8
secondary_outcome.description: The test for CRP is a laboratory measurement for evaluation of an acute phase reactant of inflammation through the use of an ultrasensitive assay. A decrease in the level of CRP indicates reduction in inflammation and therefore improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Level of Fecal Calprotectin at Week 2, 4, 8 and 12
secondary_outcome.description: Fecal calprotectin is an inflammatory marker for the gastrointestinal tract and considered as a measurement of neutrophil migration to the gastrointestinal tract. Higher values indicate more serious inflammation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2 hours post-dose on Day 1, 0 (pre-dose) and 1 hour post-dose on Week 2, Week 4, 0 (pre-dose), 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2 hours post-dose on Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Summary statistics were calculated for each dose group using the nominal collection times and by setting concentration values below the lower limit of quantification (LLOQ) (LLOQ=0.1 nanogram per milliliter [ng/mL]) to zero.

intervention.description: Administration via oral route twice daily for the duration of treatment
Administration via oral route twice daily for the duration of treatment
Administration via oral route twice daily for the duration of treatment
Administration via oral route twice daily for the duration of treatment
Administration via oral route twice daily for the duration of treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must be at least 18 years of age at screening
- Males and female patients with clinical diagnosis of ulcerative colitis â‰¥3 months prior to entry into the study.
- Male and female patients with active currently moderate to severe ulcerative colitis defined by Mayo score of â‰¥6
- Patients with endoscopic sub-score of â‰¥2 on the Mayo score determined within 7 days of baseline.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of Crohn's disease or diagnosis of indeterminate colitis
- Treatment naive subjects who have not had previous exposure to treatment for ulcerative colitis
- Patients that are currently receiving immunosuppressants, anti-TNFÎ± therapy or interferon

group.description: Placebo tablet matched to CP-690,550 orally twice daily for 8 weeks.

class.title: Greater than or equal to (>=) 65 years

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Response
outcome.description: Clinical response was defined as a decrease from baseline in Mayo score of at least 3 points and at least 30 percent, with accompanying decrease in subscore for rectal bleeding of at least 1 point or absolute subscore for rectal bleeding of 0 or 1. Mayo score: instrument designed to measure disease activity of ulcerative colitis. Total score range: 0 to 12; higher score=more severe disease. It consisted of 4 subscores: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, findings of flexible proctosigmoidoscopy and physician global assessment, each ranged from 0 to 3 (0=normal, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe).
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS): all participants who withdrew as treatment failure (TF) or completed >=1 week dosing, had >=1 valid Mayo score during active double-blind phase. Participants who withdrew as TF=non-responders. Missing data due to reason other than TF were excluded. N (number of participants analyzed)=evaluable participants for the measure.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Response
measure.description: Clinical response was defined as a decrease from baseline in Mayo score of at least 3 points and at least 30 percent, with accompanying decrease in subscore for rectal bleeding of at least 1 point or absolute subscore for rectal bleeding of 0 or 1. Mayo score: instrument designed to measure disease activity of ulcerative colitis. Total score range: 0 to 12; higher score=more severe disease. It consisted of 4 subscores: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, findings of flexible proctosigmoidoscopy and physician global assessment, each ranged from 0 to 3 (0=normal, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe).
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS): all participants who withdrew as treatment failure (TF) or completed >=1 week dosing, had >=1 valid Mayo score during active double-blind phase. Participants who withdrew as TF=non-responders. Missing data due to reason other than TF were excluded. N (number of participants analyzed)=evaluable participants for the measure.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Remission
outcome.description: Clinical remission was defined as a total Mayo score of 2 points or lower, with no individual subscore exceeding 1 point. Mayo score:instrument designed to measure disease activity of ulcerative colitis. Total score range: 0 to 12; higher score=more severe disease. It consisted of 4 subscores: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, findings of flexible proctosigmoidoscopy and physician global assessment, each ranged from 0 to 3 (0=normal, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe).
outcome.population: FAS: all participants who either withdrew as treatment failure TF or completed >=1 week dosing, had >=1 valid Mayo score during active double-blind phase. Participants who withdrew as TF were treated as non-responders. Missing data due to reason other than TF were excluded. N=evaluable participants for the measure.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Endoscopic Remission
measure.description: Endoscopic remission was defined as the findings of flexible proctosigmoidoscopy subscore of the Mayo score equals 0. Mayo score: instrument designed to measure disease activity of ulcerative colitis. Total score range: 0 to 12; higher score=more severe disease. It consisted of 4 subscores: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, findings of flexible proctosigmoidoscopy and physician global assessment, each ranged from 0 to 3 (0=normal, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe).
measure.population: FAS: all participants who either withdrew as treatment failure TF or completed >=1 week dosing, had >=1 valid Mayo score during active double-blind phase. Participants who withdrew as TF were treated as non-responders. Missing data due to reason other than TF were excluded. N=evaluable participants for the measure.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Partial Mayo Score at Week 2, 4, 8 and 12
outcome.description: Partial Mayo score was ranged from 0 (normal or inactive disease) to 9 (severe disease) and calculated as the sum of 3 subscores: stool frequency, rectal bleeding and physician's global assessment, each ranged from 0 to 3 (0=normal, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe).
outcome.population: FAS: all participants who either withdrew as TF or completed >=1 week of dosing, had >=1 valid Mayo score during active double-blind phase. Baseline-observation-carried-forward (BOCF) was used for participants who withdrew as TF. Missing data due to reasons other than treatment failure were excluded. N=evaluable participants for the measure.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Partial Mayo Score at Week 2, 4, 8 and 12
measure.description: Partial Mayo score was ranged from 0 (normal or inactive disease) to 9 (severe disease) and calculated as the sum of 3 subscores: stool frequency, rectal bleeding and physician's global assessment, each ranged from 0 to 3 (0=normal, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe).
measure.population: FAS: all participants who either withdrew as TF or completed >=1 week of dosing, had >=1 valid Mayo score during active double-blind phase. Baseline-observation-carried-forward (BOCF) was used for participants who withdrew as TF. Missing data due to reasons other than treatment failure were excluded. N=evaluable participants for the measure.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Total Inflammatory Bowel Disease Questionnaire (IBDQ) Score at Week 8
outcome.description: IBDQ: Psychometrically validated patient reported outcome (PRO) instrument for measuring disease-specific quality of life (QOL) in participants with IBD. IBDQ consists of 32 items, each item score ranged from 1 (worst possible response) to 7 (best possible response). Total score is sum of each item score, ranged from 32 to 224 with higher score indicates better QOL. Positive change in total score indicated improvement in QOL.
outcome.population: FAS: all participants who either withdrew as TF or completed >=1 week of dosing, had >=1 valid Mayo score during active double-blind phase. Missing data were excluded. N=evaluable participants for the measure. n=number of participants at specified time point for each arm group, respectively.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Total Inflammatory Bowel Disease Questionnaire (IBDQ) Score at Week 8
measure.description: IBDQ: Psychometrically validated patient reported outcome (PRO) instrument for measuring disease-specific quality of life (QOL) in participants with IBD. IBDQ consists of 32 items, each item score ranged from 1 (worst possible response) to 7 (best possible response). Total score is sum of each item score, ranged from 32 to 224 with higher score indicates better QOL. Positive change in total score indicated improvement in QOL.
measure.population: FAS: all participants who either withdrew as TF or completed >=1 week of dosing, had >=1 valid Mayo score during active double-blind phase. Missing data were excluded. N=evaluable participants for the measure. n=number of participants at specified time point for each arm group, respectively.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Level of C-Reactive Protein (CRP) at Week 4 and 8
outcome.description: The test for CRP is a laboratory measurement for evaluation of an acute phase reactant of inflammation through the use of an ultrasensitive assay. A decrease in the level of CRP indicates reduction in inflammation and therefore improvement.
outcome.population: FAS: all participants who either withdrew as TF or completed >=1 week of dosing, had >=1 valid Mayo score during active double-blind phase. Missing data were excluded. N=evaluable participants for the measure. n=number of participants at specified time point for each arm group, respectively.

N=evaluable participants for the measure. n=number of participants at specified time point for each arm group, respectively.

outcome.title: Plasma Concentration of CP-690,550
outcome.description: Summary statistics were calculated for each dose group using the nominal collection times and by setting concentration values below the lower limit of quantification (LLOQ) (LLOQ=0.1 nanogram per milliliter [ng/mL]) to zero.
outcome.time_frame: 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2 hours post-dose on Day 1, 0 (pre-dose) and 1 hour post-dose on Week 2, Week 4, 0 (pre-dose), 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2 hours post-dose on Week 8
outcome.population: Analysis population included all participants who had at least 1 plasma concentration. N=evaluable participants for this measure.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Pharmacokinetic (PK) parameters and their correlation with clinical response and inflammatory biomarkers were not reported as data from future studies were to be pooled for analysis.
